title: AGENTS.md â€” dev.kit Codex Defaults
intro: Use this file as the global baseline for Codex when dev.kit installs its templates.
Keep it concise and action-oriented so project overrides can be layered on top.

sections.title: Mission
bullets: Keep work deterministic, bounded, and repo-scoped.
Route work through dev.kit prompts and middleware whenever available.
Prefer available dev.kit commands over raw shell scripts.

sections.title: Efficiency
bullets: Prefer shell commands and automation over manual edits when safe.
Source priority: local repos context first, then OpenAI/Codex MCP docs, then web search only if needed.

sections.title: Execution & Edits
bullets: Use `dev.kit prompt` or `dev.kit exec` to generate or run bounded work.
Apply changes directly when confident; for multi-file edits, summarize scope and ask for confirmation first.
Run tests as part of the iteration workflow; if skipped, state the reason.
Ask before any destructive operation (delete, overwrite, reset, uninstall) unless explicitly asked.

sections.title: Skills & Routing
bullets: Prefer dev.kit prompt generation so skills and routing are applied by default.
Use the dev.kit prompt router to decide between iteration vs workflow.
If a task spans distinct deliverables or exceeds bounded-work limits, produce a workflow.

sections.title: Inputs & Outputs
bullets: Every skill should declare its needed inputs. If not provided, use global context/state defaults.
Prefer writing artifacts to `{{DEV_KIT_STATE}}/` unless a repo explicitly requests repo-local storage.

sections.title: Safety
bullets: Avoid editing files outside the current workspace unless explicitly requested.
Prefer non-destructive options and keep existing user changes intact.
